1‚Üí# Task Completion Protocol
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíWhen a task meets its success criteria:
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## 1. Pre-Completion Checks
     6‚Üí
     7‚ÜíVerify before proceeding:
     8‚Üí- [ ] All success criteria checked off in task file
     9‚Üí- [ ] No unaddressed work remaining
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**NOTE**: Do NOT commit yet - agents will modify files
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## 2. Run Completion Agents
    14‚Üí
    15‚ÜíDelegate to specialized agents in this order:
    16‚Üí```
    17‚Üí1. code-review agent - Review all implemented code for security/quality
    18‚Üí   Include: Changed files, task context, implementation approach
    19‚Üí   
    20‚Üí2. service-documentation agent - Update CLAUDE.md files 
    21‚Üí   Include: List of services modified during task
    22‚Üí   
    23‚Üí3. logging agent - Finalize task documentation
    24‚Üí   Include: Task completion summary, final status
    25‚Üí```
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí## 3. Task Archival
    28‚Üí
    29‚ÜíAfter agents complete:
    30‚Üí```bash
    31‚Üí# Update task file status to 'completed'
    32‚Üí# Move to done/ directory
    33‚Üímv sessions/tasks/[priority]-[task-name].md sessions/tasks/done/
    34‚Üí# or for directories:
    35‚Üímv sessions/tasks/[priority]-[task-name]/ sessions/tasks/done/
    36‚Üí```
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí## 4. Clear Task State
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí```bash
    41‚Üí# Clear task state (but keep file)
    42‚Üícat > .claude/state/current_task.json << 'EOF'
    43‚Üí{
    44‚Üí  "task": null,
    45‚Üí  "branch": null,
    46‚Üí  "services": [],
    47‚Üí  "updated": "$(date +%Y-%m-%d)"
    48‚Üí}
    49‚ÜíEOF
    50‚Üí```
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí## 5. Git Operations (Commit & Merge)
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí### Step 1: Review Unstaged Changes
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí```bash
    57‚Üí# Check for any unstaged changes
    58‚Üígit status
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# If changes exist, present them to user:
    61‚Üí# "I found the following unstaged changes: [list]
    62‚Üí# Would you like to:
    63‚Üí# 1. Commit all changes (git add -A)
    64‚Üí# 2. Select specific changes to commit
    65‚Üí# 3. Review changes first"
    66‚Üí```
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí### Step 2: Determine Branch Type
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí1. Check the current branch name
    71‚Üí2. Determine if this is a subtask or regular task:
    72‚Üí   - **Subtask**: Branch name has pattern like `tt\d+[a-z]` (e.g., tt1a, tt234b)
    73‚Üí   - **Regular task**: Branch name like `feature/*`, `fix/*`, or `tt\d+` (no letter)
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí### Step 3: Check for Super-repo Structure
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí```bash
    78‚Üí# Check if we're in a super-repo with submodules
    79‚Üíif [ -f .gitmodules ]; then
    80‚Üí  echo "Super-repo detected with submodules"
    81‚Üí  # Follow submodule commit ordering below
    82‚Üíelse
    83‚Üí  echo "Standard repository"
    84‚Üí  # Skip to step 4
    85‚Üífi
    86‚Üí```
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí### Step 4: Commit and Merge (Conditional on Structure)
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí**IF SUPER-REPO**: Process from deepest submodules to super-repo
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí#### A. Deepest Submodules First (Depth 2+)
    93‚ÜíFor any submodules within submodules:
    94‚Üí1. Navigate to each modified deep submodule
    95‚Üí2. Stage changes based on user preference from Step 1
    96‚Üí3. Commit all changes with descriptive message
    97‚Üí4. Merge based on branch type:
    98‚Üí   - Subtask ‚Üí merge into parent task branch
    99‚Üí   - Regular task ‚Üí merge into main
   100‚Üí5. Push the merged branch
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí#### B. Direct Submodules (Depth 1)
   103‚ÜíFor all modified direct submodules:
   104‚Üí1. Navigate to each modified submodule
   105‚Üí2. Stage changes based on user preference
   106‚Üí3. Commit all changes with descriptive message
   107‚Üí4. Merge based on branch type:
   108‚Üí   - Subtask ‚Üí merge into parent task branch
   109‚Üí   - Regular task ‚Üí merge into main
   110‚Üí5. Push the merged branch
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí#### C. Super-repo (Root)
   113‚ÜíAfter ALL submodules are committed and merged:
   114‚Üí1. Return to super-repo root
   115‚Üí2. Stage changes based on user preference
   116‚Üí3. Commit all changes with descriptive message
   117‚Üí4. Merge based on branch type:
   118‚Üí   - Subtask ‚Üí merge into parent task branch
   119‚Üí   - Regular task ‚Üí merge into main
   120‚Üí5. Push the merged branch
   121‚Üí
   122‚Üí**IF STANDARD REPO**: Simple commit and merge
   123‚Üí1. Stage changes based on user preference
   124‚Üí2. Commit with descriptive message
   125‚Üí3. Merge based on branch type (subtask ‚Üí parent, regular ‚Üí main)
   126‚Üí4. Push the merged branch
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí### Special Cases
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí**Experiment branches:**
   131‚Üí- Ask user whether to keep the experimental branch for reference
   132‚Üí- If keeping: Just push branches without merging
   133‚Üí- If not: Document findings first, then delete branches
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí**Research tasks (no branch):**
   136‚Üí- No merging needed
   137‚Üí- Just ensure findings are documented in task file
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí## 6. Select Next Task
   140‚Üí

   152‚Üí- Switch to task branch: `git checkout [branch-name]`
   153‚Üí- Update task state: Edit `.claude/state/current_task.json` with new task, branch, and services
   154‚Üí- Follow task-startup.md protocol
